title: Africa Sustainable Livestock 2050: Biosafety and Public Health Practices in Poultry Farming in Kenya

tasks.task: Meet Winnie Wangoi, a poultry farmer from Juju in Kiambu County in Kenya.
subtasks: Explain her involvement as one of 50 pilot farmers in a FAO practice and behavior study.
Discuss FAO's Africa Sustainable Livestock 2050 project and its focus on safeguarding public health.
Describe the development of a checklist for biosecurity practices to reduce emerging zoonotic diseases and mitigate antimicrobial resistance.
Explain the role of county and national veterinary services in stakeholder adoption of the checklist.
Detail FAO's training methods and their impact on improving farm practices, such as separating clean and dirty areas.
Highlight the benefits of proper practices, including reduced mortality, faster slaughter weight, and better financial outcomes.
Separate clean and dirty areas on the farm.
Properly handle feathers and carcasses to maintain hygiene.
Obtain a certificate after completing training.

tasks.task: Adapt legal poultry value chain procedures in Kenya.
subtasks: Comply with existing laws governing poultry farming.
Address gaps in current regulations to improve implementation.
Utilize training and resources from FAO to enhance farm management practices.

tasks.task: Anticipate and address public health concerns related to livestock.
subtasks: Focus on preventing the spread of emerging infectious diseases like salmonella.
Mitigate the risk of antimicrobial resistance through biosecurity practices.
